intro: Lappula shanhsiensis, commonly known as Shanhsi lappula, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. It has a short stature and often thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant resilience in harsh climates.
